channel.title: Working Tor->VPN->SSH Connection / Proxychains
channel.description:
Hello guys,
i am sorry for my bad english. I want to try to describe my problem/question. My Setup: Host: Kali Linux Virtualbox: Whonix Workstation + Gateway
Ich want to get a working Connection to the Internet over Tor -> VPN -> SSH -> Internet
So i start on the Workstation my VPN- and SSH-Connection. Then i start proxychains with following settings:
[ProxyList] socks5 127.0.0.1 8050 (SSH)
If I go then on ipcheck sites like ip-check.info, I have the IP / Location from the SSH.
...So all is working fine....but can I trust proxychains that my IP is tunneling all the way??? (Tor -> VPN -> SSH) ..Or only Tor -> SSH??? Must I add TOR or the VPN in some way in the proxylist?
Thank you for your help.

item.title: Working Tor->VPN->SSH Connection / Proxychains
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
peets:

can I trust proxychains that my IP is tunneling all the way?

No.

The relevant sentence from https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tunnels/Connecting_to_Tor_before_a_proxy#General:

If the Proxifier is leak free or in worst case leaks through Tor alone (thanks to Whonix), is another question and not in Whonix’s power, see TorifyHOWTO.

If these programs were reliable, there would be less need for Whonix.

Read full topic

item.title: Working Tor->VPN->SSH Connection / Proxychains
item.dc:creator: peets
item.description:
Hello guys,

i am sorry for my bad english. I want to try to describe my problem/question.
My Setup:
Host: Kali Linux
Virtualbox: Whonix Workstation + Gateway

Ich want to get a working Connection to the Internet over Tor -> VPN -> SSH -> Internet

So i start on the Workstation my VPN- and SSH-Connection.
Then i start proxychains with following settings:

[ProxyList]
socks5 127.0.0.1 8050 (SSH)

If I go then on ipcheck sites like ip-check.info, I have the IP / Location from the SSH.

…So all is working fine…but can I trust proxychains that my IP is tunneling all the way??? (Tor -> VPN -> SSH) …Or only Tor -> SSH???
Must I add TOR or the VPN in some way in the proxylist?

Thank you for your help.

Read full topic
